creditline: The Mary Ruth Weisel Endowment for Africa, Oceania, and the Americas
department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: oblong shield curved lengthwise down the center with a triangular, wooden mound protruding at middle; body of shield is decorated with grid of brown, woven plant fibers, with elongated triangular designs framing the edges--points oriented toward center; animal skin with traces of fur lines the outer edges of shield; a curved, wooden handle wrapped in plant fibers is on the reverse of the shield at center
title: Shield
